title: Celtic advance after wobble against Utrecht
desc: Celtic set up a Europa League play-off clash with either Robbie Keane's Ferencvaros or Stuttgart after beating Dutch side FC Utrecht 4-2 in their final group stage match at Celtic Park.

title: Celtic 4-2 Utrecht: Hoops progress to Europa League play-offs
desc: Report as Celtic beat Utrecht 4-2 in the Europa League; Scottish Premiership champions qualify for Februarys play-offs; strikes from Benjamin Nygren, a Nick Viergever OG, an Arne Engels penalty and Auston Trusty were enough for victory; Celtic will now face Stuttgart or Ferencvaros

title: Horowhenua College teacher Dylan Kiriona censured after flipping trailer carrying 15 students
desc: A secondary school teacher “thought it would be fun” for 15 students to take a ride in a trailer he was towing, as they’d been working hard all morning on a...

title: Man who squirted vinegar on Rep. Ilhan Omar is charged
desc: The Justice Department has charged a man who squirted apple cider vinegar on Democratic U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar at an event in Minneapolis.

title: Venezuelan Lawmakers Approve Sweeping Overhaul of Oil Sector
desc: Bowing to Trump administration pressure, the new legislation improves conditions for foreign oil companies and opens the way to slash the taxes they pay.

title: Saks to close most of its Off 5th and Last Call discount stores
desc: The parent company of Saks Off 5th and Last Call will close most locations to focus on its luxury retail stores after filing for bankruptcy this month.

title: HIV i-Base: Do ATIs in HIV cure-related studies cause anxiety?
desc: A study monitored anxiety levels using questionnaires that were self-completed before and during an ATI in two small studies.

title: SA app turns chores into game
desc: ChoreQuest applies challenges and rewards to family routines, helping children learn responsibility.

title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX Is Said to Consider Merger With Tesla or xAI
desc: SpaceX is considering a potential merger with Tesla Inc., as well as an alternative combination with artificial intelligence firm xAI, according to people familiar with the matter, a sign billionaire Elon Musk is weighing how to consolidate his empire.

title: Man who stole over €129,000 worth of electronics from employer is jailed
desc: Magdi Ba (45) stole 371 electronic items, including smartwatches, Fitbits, phones and laptops, from DID Electrical over a three-year period, which he then sold on to another shop.
